item.title: Tomb Raider 4-6 Remastered: 7 Things That Need To Be Improved
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Rework the Egyptian theme in Tomb Raider 4 to create a fresh visual separation in each area.
  • Improve the rope swing mechanics in Tomb Raider 4 and 5 for a smoother and less frustrating experience.
  • Enhance the tightrope walking controls in Tomb Raider Chronicles to make the movement more fluid and modern.

Following the success of the remastered Tomb Raider trilogy, Aspyr and Crystal Dynamics will now be following suit by remastering Tomb Raider: The Last Revelation , Tomb Raider: Chronicles , and Tomb Raider: The Angel of Darkness . It has been announced that Tomb Raider 4-6 Remastered will arrive on PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 on Feb. 14, 2025, but there are a few things the developers need to get right to polish up the next few chapters in Lara Croft's globe-trotting adventures.

Related
Which Tomb Raider Game is Your Favorite?

While any of the more recent Tomb Raider titles/remakes are among some of my favorite video games ever, my favorite Tomb Raider title has to be the 2013 Tomb Raider/Tomb Raider Definitive Edition game. This was one of my favorite titles to play on the PS4, the whole reason I got back into the Tomb Raider franchise, and I found the storyline regarding Himiko to be really intriguing and enjoyable.

Tomb Raider 4 feels like it fits right at home with the original trilogy, but Tomb Raider 5 serves as one big flashback to the events of the previous installment, and Tomb Raider 6 (viewed more favorably nowadays) received a lot of criticism upon release for being a stylish entry but lacking true substance compared to its predecessors. None of them are perfect games, even if Tomb Raider 4 is arguably the more beloved of the three, and there's still plenty to iron out to make these titles a more enjoyable experience.

7 Rework The Egyptian Theme

Introduce Some Variations To The Egyptian Setting

One of Tomb Raider 4 's biggest selling points also happens to be one of its biggest drawbacks. The Last Revelation feels like everything one would expect from the original Tomb Raider trilogy, but that's precisely why it can get quite repetitive. The level design is still superior, as the setting really translates as being a faithful rendition of Egypt, but the levels are less diverse than some of the older games.

Everything takes place in Egypt, which is a great deviation from the norm, but it also means that jumping from Karnak to Cairo and Giza doesn't offer much variation. For the remaster, Tomb Raider 4 would definitely benefit from a rework that creates a distinctive visual separation between each Egyptian environment so that every area feels fresh and not just a rehashed version of the previous major Egyptian city.

6 Make The Rope Swings Less Trifling

Avoid Several Unintentional Deaths Due To Unreliable Mechanics

Just like Spider-Man's web shooters, many games benefit from inventive travel mechanics that make the environment feel more interactive. As Lara Croft traverses Rome, the coast of Russia, an island off the coast of Ireland, famous Egyptian landmarks, and good old NYC, it's important that she has viable means of getting around. But, there were a lot of complaints as to Lara's rope-swinging escapades, especially in Tomb Raider: The Last Revelation and Tomb Raider: Chronicles . In fact, players were finding it so troublesome to swing from platform to platform that they found themselves crying out for help in online threads.

For reference, here's how to properly swing on the ropes in Tomb Raider 4 and Tomb Raider 5 :

  • Go all the way to the bottom, line yourself up, hold sprint, and then press jump at the end of the swing.

Although it all sounds fairly straightforward, it would be so much easier for Aspyr and Crystal Dynamics to rework the rope swing system altogether and make it less clunky and more intuitive, especially since it would save Lara Croft from several embarrassing deaths.

5 Make Tightrope Walking Faster

Renowned Archeologist Lara Croft Can Move Faster Than That

As if rope swings weren't bad enough, there's also the matter of tightropes in Tomb Raider: Chronicles . Granted, it makes sense that Lara Croft doesn't move across a tightrope like a superhuman, but it's also off-putting to watch her dawdle across the tightrope as if she isn't an archeologist renowned for her intelligence and athleticism.

Aside from the fact that the tightrope walk seems to take way too long, the controls aren't the smoothest either. It's a real process to get Lara walking forward, and when she starts to wobble as if she might fall off, the trick is to press the directional arrows opposite to whichever way she's leaning. This is one of the trickiest parts of the Rome level, despite there being no real threat, so it wouldn't hurt to make the whole motion more fluid and adapt it to incorporate modern PS4/PS5 controls.

4 Fix All Bugs

Many Bugs Make The Game Less Challenging

As with the remastered Tomb Raider trilogy, Crystal Dynamics and Aspyr have some prominent bugs to fix for all three games (T he Last Revelation, Chronicles , and The Angel of Darkness ), which would make the gameplay experience more enjoyable overall. These bugs pertain to Lara glitching inside of walls and leaping all the way up to higher platforms, triggering enemies and cutscenes from inside said walls, falling through floors, Lara keeping her gun in hand while climbing, and in the case of Tomb Raider 6 — the game simply crashing.

Here are some of the known bugs from Tomb Raider: The Last Revelation , Tomb Raider: Chronicles , and Tomb Raider: The Angel of Darkness :

  • Corner Bug - Standing right next to the corner, turning 45 degrees to face away from the wall, and then jumping can glitch Lara to the top of a ledge.
  • Flare Bug - While facing a wall and turned slightly to the left, drop a flare, roll, crawl, and then grab the flare again; Lara will teleport to the top of the platform.
  • Trigger Bug - Start off by performing a corner bug or flare bug, and when inside the wall, start jumping up to potentially trigger an event, such as spawning an enemy or activating a cutscene.
  • Falling Through The Floor Bug - Position Lara in front of a slope, press roll, then press roll again, and Lara will fall through the wall into the next level.
  • Holding Weapon While Climbing Bug - Draw a weapon, jump up, go to the inventory in midair, then select a different weapon.
  • The Mickey Mouse Voice Bug - Occurs randomly when Lara talks faster than normal.
  • Tomb Raider: The Angel of Darkness crashing unexpectedly.

3 Shorten Loading Times Between Zones

Long Loading Times Can Be Disorienting

In Tomb Raider: The Last Revelation , some of the loading screens dragged on for an indeterminate amount of time between new levels/zones. While it's easy to appreciate the architecture inside the tombs — and even the hieroglyphic markings that feel true to the time period — it's a little disorienting to wait so long between new locations, especially after beating a particularly jarring puzzle.

After completing one level, players are often itching to move on and get their bearings again, so waiting too long to load in can feel tedious. It might not be realistic to remove loading screens altogether, especially as the developers are using the original game's same engine and code, but it might be more feasible to shorten the loading times, or at least insert a notification instead to let players know which zone they're entering.

2 Make Cutscenes Skippable

Seasoned Players Want To Jump Right Into The Action

It might sound blasphemous to even consider skipping cutscenes as Tomb Raider: Chronicles is packed with backstory pertaining to Tomb Raider: The Last Revelation . However, since the game is mainly one big flashback, it isn't entirely necessary for seasoned players to watch all the events unfold as they recall them.

If anything, newer players would benefit from the cutscenes, but veterans can just coast by and enjoy the scenery rather than investing too heavily in a story they will likely remember all too well. It wouldn't necessarily take away from Tomb Raider: Chronicles to make the cutscenes skippable, but it would fix the same issue as the loading screen argument and make the game flow more seamlessly.

1 Fix Overall Gameplay Flow

Bring Back The Original Controls

There was a whole debacle over the control scheme of Tomb Raider: The Angel of Darkness upon its release, particularly as the original controls were made identical to the PS1, utilizing the D-pad primarily for movement and leaving out the analogue sticks altogether. At that time, most PS2 games were utilizing the analog stick as a sort of experimental way forward. Sony wasn't really happy with the Tomb Raider premiere on the PS2 not featuring the complete controller, so Sony told Core Design to change it. All of this happened when the game was already well behind schedule, so Core Design had time constraints and couldn't work it out.

This setback resulted in clunky controls for Tomb Raider: The Angel of Darkness , especially on PC, as none of the original controls would transfer properly on other platforms. The remaster should fix the control issue as a given, which it almost certainly will, but Angel of Darkness should take out (or rework) its silly strength system (from where the "I feel stronger now" meme originated) and also polish the introductory and Kurtis levels, which both had unfinished/unreachable areas.

item.title: Meta Appears to Be Testing a Wider Field of View For Its VR Headsets
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Meta is testing a prototype VR headset with a wider field of view than existing Quest models.
  • The design includes angled lenses for improved FOV, but it's still in the early stages.
  • Don't expect a wide FOV headset from Meta soon, as they're currently focused on Quest 3S release.

Meta appears to be working on a prototype VR headset that features a wider field of view than any of its existing Meta Quest headsets. A recent image released shows the company's CTO taking a look at some of the experiments that are being tested within Meta's Reality Labs.

Meta is constantly testing new designs for its various peripherals, with some images of these items either being officially shared or leaked onto the internet from time to time. The Meta Quest 3S headset was semi-teased in a prior image of the CTO, where the then-unannounced VR headset was sitting on a shelf behind him. Now, a new reveal seems to indicate that the company is testing wider FOVs for headsets.

In an image shared by the Meta CTO Andrew Bosworth on Instagram, keen-eyed viewers noticed that one of the headsets he was examining looked quite different. The image shows a prototype VR headset that looks like it curves around the sides of the face, rather than simply fitting across the front of the face. The lenses are angled, which would play a big role in improving how wide the field of view is on future headsets. The design is clearly only intended as a prototype, as it's wired and has clunky attachments, but it's intriguing to see that Meta may be contemplating the possibility of a wider FOV in the future.

Will Meta Release a Wide FOV VR Headset?

While this is indeed a test by Meta, that doesn't necessarily mean that it will make it to consumers. Meta is constantly innovating and testing to determine what would be a good feature and work well for its future products. Meta's La Jolla project was recently canceled, which was allegedly going to compete with the Apple Vision Pro and possibly be called the Meta Quest Pro 2. However, Bosworth noted that the company has prototypes in development "at all times" and that not everything is actually produced. The company has multiple stages of experimentation before ideas ever make it to the prototype phase. Even once products reach the final phase, they may still end up canceled by the company before ever being announced to consumers.

For now, VR enthusiasts shouldn't hold their breath for a wide FOV headset to launch from Meta. Right now, Meta is focused on the recent release of its Quest 3S, with no official information about a Meta Quest 4 or follow-up at this time. Even if this prototype makes it through all the phases and gets an official launch, it would likely be several years out from now.

item.title: Star Trucker: How to Repair Hull
item.description:
In Star Trucker , you'll need to transport goods across the stars in a safe and timely manner for maximum rewards. However, accidents happen and a collision with another truck or some loose debris can damage the hull. It's up to you to fix it and keep on trucking. Here are the ways you can repair the hull of your truck and get back to transporting freight across the galaxy of Star Trucker.

Hull Breaches

Hull breaches are the first thing the game teaches you about. Space lanes are populated with other trucks and signs. Journey outside of the space lanes and there is all sorts of small debris that you can hit. Collisions will result in small hull breaches on the outside of your truck.

Regularly check the truck status on your cockpit screens to stay on top of the damage. The Truck Status screen will display any breaches and what percentage of your hull integrity is at. Your truck will also look dirty and damaged if you are flying in third person. Hull breaches are very dangerous as they will lead to oxygen leaking from your truck's cabin. Run out of oxygen, and you'll be recovered to the nearest station. You'll then have to deal with a hefty recovery fee.

Once you've received a hull breach, you need to manually repair them. Put on your space suit and exit the airlock. Your HUD will show you where the breaches are. You'll need suit power to repair each breach. The suit power is represented in the lights on the left side of the HUD when wearing the space suit.

Upgrade Shops

Repairing the small breaches will not fix your overall hull status. For this, you'll need to visit a truck upgrade shop. There will usually be one at the central station in each area.

Dock at the upgrade station and choose to repair your hull. This will be free until the warranty expires on your truck. Once it expires at 80,000 miles, you will have to pay cash to repair it. You can also buy upgrades to make your hull sturdier and more resistant to damage.

item.title: Games With Cross Platform Saves
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Cross-platform saves in games like Daemon X Machina enable players to switch between Nintendo Switch and PC seamlessly via Steam Cloud.
  • Games like Immortals: Fenyx Rising and Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War offer cross-progression through multi-platform cloud saves.
  • Hoyoverse titles, such as Genshin Impact and Honkai Impact 3rd , support cross-play and cross-progression across multiple platforms.

Games with cross-platform saves are becoming the norm, thanks to cloud storage and multiplatform gamers. Cross-progression allows players to pick up where they left off on the couch or on the go if they don’t feel like booting up their desktops. It’s also a bonus for companies as gamers aren’t discouraged by lengthy replays if they buy the game again.

Cross-platform saves for games with co-op campaigns also incentivize players to grab another copy. This is especially true for story-rich games or titles with hundreds of unlockables. Regardless if it’s single or multiplayer, developers can extend a game’s lifespan by implementing this simple quality-of-life feature.

Updated on October 18, 2024, by Rie Takumi : Games with cross-platform saves as a model are mostly released by companies that have full control over their games. Square Enix, Ubisoft, Larian, and Fireaxis, among others, implement cross-progression by linking saves to the user's account on their platform. Meanwhile, companies like Marvelous use platform-tied cloud saves to provide cross-saves.

The variety of games with cross-platform saves has expanded. Hoyoverse and Activision Blizzard tie their free, games-as-a-service behemoths to cross-progression to improve reach. But studios like Supergiant Games recognize that their single player games also need this feature and roll it out for free. There's hope that more games will come out with cross save support, especially as consoles nearly run on par with PCs.

20 Kingdom: Two Crowns

Tower Defense Single And Split-Screen Multiplayer Strategy

A lone monarch, or two on split-screen multiplayer, must defend their kingdom from monsters called Greed in Kingdoms Two Crowns . Over a slow day and night cycle, monarchs assign villagers to build walls and towers, farm and hunt for food, and defend the crown. Greed can strip villagers bare and cause them to abandon, so wily monarchs must also defend their people, if only to save on resources.

The Continue Anywhere update introduced cross-saves across devices the player bought the game on. Players need only set up a Kingdom account to have their monarchs hop across platforms.

19 Phantom Blade: Executioners

Wuxia ARPG With Jaw-Dropping Painted Artstyle

Platform(s)

  • PlayStation 5
  • Android
  • iOS
  • Microsoft Windows

Released

November 2, 2023

Genre(s)

  • RPG
  • Fighting
  • Adventure

Developer(s)

S-GAME

OpenCritic

62%

Phantom Blade: Executioners is a gorgeous ARPG set in a wuxia-style world where players must set right the sins of their sects. Players choose between five characters with two class paths tailored for offensive and defensive gameplay. Stringing together combos with basic attacks, skills, and ults is easy, which makes clearing areas feel quick and engaging. With art and music that modernizes wuxia or fantasy Chinese martial arts, Phantom Blade offers an alternative to current gacha ARPGs.

The side-scrolling action game offers cross-play between its mobile, PlayStation, and PC versions. Its availability is great for players on the go, and those with friends who want to co-op or PvP across platforms.

18 Daemon X Machina

Command Mechs Across The Switch And PC

Platform(s)

  • Nintendo Switch
  • Microsoft Windows

Released

  • September 13, 2019 (Nintendo Switch)
  • February 13, 2020 (Microsoft Windows)

Genre(s)

  • Action
  • Third-Person Shooter

Developer(s)

Marvelous First Studio

Metascore

69

In Daemon X Machina , players protect the Planet from the Arms of Immortals with mechs and special abilities. Arsenal are fully customizable mechs with swappable weapons and parts that can be earned or salvaged from defeated enemies. Parts and weapons determine the pacing and range of every battle, though fights are typically comparable to a faster Armored Core .

Cross-saves are enabled between the Windows PC and Nintendo Switch versions via Steam Cloud. Switch users can also transfer their saves to the Epic Games version, though the process is more involved than transfers from Epic to the Switch.

17 Siralim Ultimate

Collect, Fuse, & Explore Dungeons With Monsters

Platform(s)

  • Nintendo Switch
  • Microsoft Windows
  • iOS
  • Android

Released

March 12, 2021

Genre(s)

  • Adventure
  • Indie
  • Role Playing Game
  • Fantasy

Developer(s)

Marvelous First Studio

Metascore

  • Very Positive (1,390 Steam reviews)
  • 4.6 Stars (927 Google Play reviews)
  • 4.7 (181 App Store reviews)

Although still in Early Access, Siralim Ultimate boasts a ton of content from its nearly three years in Early Access. Over 1,000 creatures can be captured and trained, or fused to distill overpowered skills into one powered-up beast, and players have 20 classes with skills that complement their monsters. Dungeons can go as deep as 666 levels, are populated by bosses, full of loot, and monsters as well, which is perfect for players who love grinding away at challenges.

Siralim Ultimate is available across multiple platforms. While players must buy the game for each platform, their progression carries over via cloud storage.

16 Immortals: Fenyx Rising

Save Greek Gods From Mythical Beasts & Titans

Boasting a vibrant color palette and appropriately fantastic designs, Immortals: Fenyx Rising offers open-world combat with the powers of the Greek gods. Immortals: Fenyx Rising's stylized world made the game stand out at launch, but its free-roam combat is nothing to sneeze at. The quick-paced aerial and ground combat with arcade-like controls feels similar to the first God of War , where it's fun to tap, parry, and dodge.

Cross-saves or cross-progression works in Immortals: Fenyx Rising thanks to Ubisoft's multi-platform cloud save system. Players need only link their platform account to their Ubisoft account, which can accommodate up to four cloud saves. It must be noted that players have to manually select "Online Save" or "Load From Online" to make use of this feature.

15 RuneScape

More Than 20 Years Later, Classic MMO Still Active and Thriving

Cross-platform wasn’t an issue at all with RuneScape , an MMO that has been around since 2001. The classic MMORPG only crossed the threshold in 2021 when RuneScape was released for Android and iOS. Since then, players can hop on with friends or wheel solo from mobile to PC and back.

Most of the game’s new updates are cordoned off for members, but free-to-play users have unlimited playtime and can reach level 99 without paying at all. It’s great for players who want a stress-free, grindy game to play in the background with friends, single players craving MMO gameplay, and gamers who love grinding or titles that enable switching tasks on the fly.

14 Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War

A ctivision Continues Cross-Progression With Their Recent Black Ops Entry

Activision supports full cross-progression across all platforms for Call of Duty®: Black Ops Cold War . Any progress made on Battle Pass for Warzone also applies to Cold War . It's a great deal for players who own the game on multiple platforms and made significant progress in the game.

Like other Call of Duty games, Cold War' s gameplay is unchanging but its single-player campaign features multiple player-determinant endings. It also features Fireteam, a new game mode that supports up to 40 players. Zombies also has a new campaign based on the Aether story.

13 SMITE

SMITE Cross-Progression Possible Across 3 Major Platforms

SMITE distinguishes itself from other MOBAs with its third-person perspective. Lowering the POV changes how its MOBA mechanics feel, from bodyblocking, to sneaking, skillshotting, and even landing. SMITE also offers more casual-friendly modes and easier, and cheaper, ways to unlock characters than its competitors.

The MOBA also allows PC, Xbox One, PlayStation 4, and Switch cross-play, cross-progression, and cross-commerce. Voice chat and cross-input parties are also possible across platforms. Unlike other cross-progression games, these features are available in-game and do not require a Hi-Rez account.

12 Hoyoverse Games

HoYoverse Maintains Strong Cross-Progression For All Titles

Genshin Impact, Honkai: Star Rail , and Honkai Impact 3rd allow cross-play and cross-progression. This feature allows mobile players to relieve their phones of each game’s massive memory demand. The convenience of cloud saves also lets console and desktop players take their saves on the road.

Because all three require a Hoyoverse account, players automatically unlock cross-platform features. Additionally, Honkai: Star Rail ’s PlayStation 5 version will also support cross-saves. But the same can’t be said of Genshin Impact’s announced Switch release, which remains shrouded in mystery.

11 MLB The Show 23

Progression Is Transferrable But Not Paid Items

MLB The Show 23 received great reviews upon release, thanks to breaking out PlayStation exclusivity and a load of new features. A competitive multiplayer mode and update to pitching and batting encouraged players to hop on a game online. Ranked co-op functions were also expanded for a richer experience with friends.

Players can move from platform to platform by creating an MLB The Show account. Linking console accounts with an MLB The Show account allows players to retain their items, stubs, and XP across platforms.

10 Minecraft (Bedrock)

Cross-Save Through The Official App

Borderlands 3 and Sea of Thieves are go-to’s for action co-op gameplay, but Minecraft isn’t lacking for exciting adventures either. Recent updates added new dangerous biomes such as the deep dark escalates action on routine foraging rounds. At the same time, it remains king for creating stunning builds and comfy villages with friends.

Minecraft: Bedrock Edition allows players to access their Realms across different platforms. Windows 10 and current Nintendo, Sony, and Microsoft consoles can play the same Realm. PlayStation players need to follow a few extra steps, while iOS players can use the iCloud as an alternative.

9 Civilization 6

Carry Long-Running Saves Across Platforms

Civilization 6 is getting on in years, yet its community is still quite dedicated to it. Mods still come out for the game quite often and forums dedicated to it are still running. Even with the announcement of Civilization 7 , it still receives official updates.

One thing that helped its longevity was its cross-progression. PC, Nintendo Switch, and iOS players have access to cross-saves, with workarounds for Switch to iOS transfers. Xbox players also have access to PC cloud saves, though PS4 and Linux owners are out of luck.

8 Warframe

Story-Driven Action Game Lets Players Carry Progress Everywhere

Warframe has been around for years, but the fast-paced, third-person action shooter still has a shine for its community and new players. Players tend to get attached to the game for its gentle learning curve and fun, kinetic horde-style fights. Rewards are also fulfilling and go a long way in helping players modify their Warframe to suit scenarios and preferred fighting styles.

Players retain progression across PC, Xbox, PlayStation, Nintendo Switch, and mobile. They only need to mark one of their platform accounts as their Primary Account before linking other platform accounts to it.

7 Apex Legends

Jump From Console To PC And Back Without Worries

EA has ensured that Apex Legends has had cross-progression since 2019, and to great success. The F2P hero shooter is consistently in the top five most-played games on Steam and most watched on Twitch. Consistent players feel like solo queue could use a bit of work, and cheating cut back, but for the most part, Apex Legends is still pretty active.

For gamers who haven’t opened Apex Legends yet, they can expect the cool abilities of Overwatch blitzed with the maneuverability of Titanfall , plus an interesting battle royale map worth committing to memory.

6 Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2

Squash Tyranids In Multiplayer-Centered Warhammer 40K Title

Although gamers can complete Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 on their own, the single-player campaign still plays like the co-op campaign. The bug-squashing shoot-em-up makes no bones about its multiplayer focus with its overwhelming hordes and need for coordination.

Cross-saves and cross-play are critical to the co-op experience and work seamlessly. Only PvP has platform limitations to keep things fair between platforms. To access cross-saves, players need to register with Prism Ray Online Services (PROS), a new service that also works for games like Dead Island 2 and Kingdom Come: Deliverance II .

5 Diablo 4

Chief Among Activision Blizzard’s Cross-Platform, Cross-Progression Games

A defining feature of Diablo 4, since before launch, is its emphasis on online play. Day one cross-saves and cross-play were guaranteed, as players needed constant internet connection for access. Cross-progression in this case also covers cosmetics, even console-exclusive ones.

Diablo 4 ’s gameplay reflects its change to an online, almost casual MMO. As a straightforward RPG, players can build a character they like, meta or not, from classes such as the beginner-friendly Barbarian and Necromancer. They obtain stronger equipment and skills the further they delve into Sanctuary’s dungeons, providing them with the means to thwart the machinations of heaven and hell.

4 Final Fantasy 14

FF14 Features Work Well On Keyboard & Controller

Nearly two years after the critically acclaimed MMORPG concluded its first main storyline with Endwalker , the game and its fans are still going. Dawntrail , the next big expansion, is hotly anticipated and will kick off a new era in unexplored lands.

If a Warrior of Light wants to play the new expansion, or whichever version they have, all they need to do is register their licenses to the same Square Enix account. Players must purchase a copy of the game and their expansions for each platform separately. However, their subscription applies to all platforms.

3 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt and Cyberpunk 2077

CD Projekt Continues Cross-Platform Support WIth New Titles

CD Projekt Red’s massive games need to be purchased for each platform separately. But their progress can be carried over across each system. Barring regional restrictions, players can load saves transferred between PCs, console to PCs, and PCs to console.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt and Cyberpunk 2077 must be updated to their latest patch before players can activate cross-progression. Its toggle can be found in the Load Game menu or under Gameplay in the Settings menu. Players must connect the games to their GOG account as well, so they can access their latest games on any connected platform.

2 Hades

Go From Couch To PC With Hades

Hades remains a favorite of rogue-like fans due to its incredibly addictive gameplay loop, vibrant cast and setting, and intriguing story. The fact that the whole story can't be unlocked unless players blaze through a dozen or so loops adds to its replayability.

Thankfully, Hades has cross-progression, which means players don't have to painstakingly unlock everything on every platform again. Players only need to select cross-saves in the main menu and connect their Steam or Epic Games account. Their saves will be automatically updated every time they quit the game.

1 Baldur's Gate 3 & Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition

Larian Studios Improves Account-Bound Cloud Saves

Larian Studios made significant improvements on Divinity: Original Sin 2 to make Baldur’s Gate 3 a smashing success . As Larian's love letter to pen-and-paper adventures, Baldur’s Gate 3 gave players the tools to unleash their creativity and fully immerse themselves in Faerûn. But Divinity: Original Sin 2 still holds up as one of the best examples of crowdfunded games and tabletop RPG-inspired videogames in recent history.

Both games also allow players to continue their journey on any platform. While cross-progression is limited to Windows, Switch, iPad, and Mac for Divinity , Baldur's Gate 3 players only need to create a Larian account to have access to their last five saves on their PC, PS5, and Mac.

item.title: World of Warcraft Shows Off Classic Timewalking Dungeons
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Classic Timewalking in WoW lets players relive iconic dungeons.
  • The event features dungeons like Deadmines, Dire Maul, Zul'Farrak, and Stratholme.
  • Dire Maul and Stratholme are both separated into two separate wings.

World of Warcraft just shared a short video showcasing the dungeons coming to Classic Timewalking. Featuring four iconic dungeons, two of which are separated into two wings each, World of Warcraft fans can challenge these six retro instances during the upcoming 20th anniversary event, and again in future Timewalking events when Classic comes up in the rotation.

On October 22, World of Warcraft begins its 20th anniversary celebration alongside the release of Patch 11.0.5. This massive in-game event runs until January 7, 2025, and features tons of content for players to enjoy. Among the new activities, Classic Timewalking gives fans a chance to relive iconic dungeons at their current level, allowing them to enter certain instances as they were in Vanilla WoW starting as early as level 10.

Now, World of Warcraft has given players a digital tour of these dungeons. In a short video posted on Twitter, Blizzard showed off the Classic dungeons coming in the new World of Warcraft Timewalking event: the Deadmines, Dire Maul, Zul’Farrak, and Stratholme. Dire Maul and Stratholme are actually separated into two separate wings – the former with the Warpwood Quarter and Capital Gardens, and the latter’s Living and Undead halves – giving fans a total of six dungeons they queue into during Classic Timewalking.

Classic Timewalking Dungeons in World of Warcraft

  • Deadmines
  • Dire Maul – Warpwood Quarter
  • Dire Maul – Capital Gardens
  • Zul’Farrak
  • Stratholme – Living side
  • Stratholme – Undead side

When World of Warcraft remade Azeroth in Cataclysm , nearly every dungeon from Vanilla was reworked in some capacity, including most of those chosen for Classic Timewalking. Because of this, the versions of some dungeons players will encounter during this event have been inaccessible in modern World of Warcraft for nearly 15 years.

Classic Timewalking also brings with it new loot to buy using Timewarped Badges. Bobadormu, the vendor for Classic Timewalking, offers a bunch of new items, including a mount, toy, several pets, reputation tokens, and a bunch of transmogs, including some item appearances directly from WoW Classic Season of Discovery. Like the event itself, these rewards will return in the future, as Classic is being added to the regular rotation of Timewalking events.

Unfortunately, Vanilla WoW had an abundance of other old dungeons, like the Wailing Caverns and old Scarlet Monastery wings, that are not in Classic Timewalking at the moment, nor is there a Timewalking raid just yet. However, World of Warcraft fans can enter Blackrock Depths – a brand-new raid version of the eponymous sprawling dungeon – during the 20th anniversary event. It remains to be seen if the Blackrock Depths raid will return again, either in future anniversary events or Classic Timewalking cycles, but the instance promises an adventure both new and nostalgic all the same.
